"We put all these men on a boat and sent them to France, and I would like to have heard more of that today."

German leader Angela Merkel and her French counterpart Emmanuel Macron have had their ups and downs. Both of them have respectively been declared the ...

French President Emmanuel Macron condemns violent Paris protests  Stuff.co.nz

French president lashes out at protesters in Paris as march against rising fuel taxes turns violent.

item.title: Paris in lockdown as 'yellow vest' protesters call for Macron to resign - ABC News
item.description:
Paris in lockdown as 'yellow vest' protesters call for Macron to resign  ABC News

Paris was in lockdown early on Saturday with thousands of security officers braced to meet renewed rioting by "yellow vest" protesters in the capital and other French cities, in a fourth weekend of confrontation over living costs. Key points: - 89,000 police have been deployed across the country, 8,000 in Paris alone - Protests are being touted as "Act IV" by those challenging President Emmanuel Macron - "Yellow vests" are demanding lower taxes, higher salaries and cheaper energy costs The Eiffel Tower and other tourist landmarks were shut, shops were boarded up to avoid looting and street ...

item.title: French police fire tear gas at protesters in central Paris - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
French police fire tear gas at protesters in central Paris  Al Jazeera English

Police fired tear gas canisters and pepper spray at 'yellow vest' protesters in central Paris on Saturday during a demonstration against the high cost of living. A police spokesperson told reporters there were about 1,500 protesters on the Champs Elysees and authorities said 127 people had been placed under arrest after police found weapons such as hammers, baseball bats and metal petanque balls on them. About 8,000 police were deployed in Paris to avoid a repeat of last Saturday's mayhem, when rioters torched cars and looted shops off the Champs Elysees boulevard, and defaced the Arc de Tr...

item.title: Gilets jaunes protests: French minister warns of 'ultra-violent people' as Paris braces for further violence - The Independent
item.description:
Gilets jaunes protests: French minister warns of 'ultra-violent people' as Paris braces for further violence  The Independent

France's interior minister has warned that "some ultra-violent people want to take part" as Paris braces itself for another weekend of anti-government protests. "According to the information we have, some radicalised and rebellious people will try to get mobilised," said Christophe Castaner. "Some ultra-violent people want to take part." Demonstrations began peacefully, as hundreds of people marched down the Champs -Elysees avenue in the centre of the French capital. But the Eiffel Tower and Louvre Museum were shut down, along with hundreds of stores and businesses, as a precaution against ...

item.title: France 'yellow vest' protests: Timeline of unrest - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
France 'yellow vest' protests: Timeline of unrest  Al Jazeera English

France has experienced weeks of social unrest since massive protests erupted across the country on November 17. The demonstrations were initially held to protest planned hikes in fuel taxes, but have since widened into an movement against the government's economic policies, leaving President Emmanuel Macron facing the biggest challenge of his presidency. Below is a timeline of the "yellow vest" movement in France, from the first online rumblings against the tax hike to nationwide protests and the worst Paris riots in decades. Viral video A video posted on Facebook on October 18 quickly goe...

item.title: As protests rages in France, Macron remains invisible - The Associated Press
item.description:
As protests rages in France, Macron remains invisible  The Associated Press

PARIS (AP) ‚Äî As anti-government protests rage through France and Paris locks down, fearing new riots, the man whose presidency has unleashed the anger is nowhere to be seen. French President Emmanuel Macron has stayed out of the public eye all week, leaving his unpopular government to try to calm the nation. In response, "Macron, resign!" has become the main slogan of the "yellow vest" demonstrators. The protesters' anger has been directed at the French leader, who they feel has been the "president of the rich" and is out-of-touch with ordinary people. Macron's pro-business reforms have aim...

item.title: France 'gilets jaunes' protesters detained and tear-gassed - CNN
item.description:
France 'gilets jaunes' protesters detained and tear-gassed  CNN

French police detained more than 200 people in Paris on Saturday and fired hundreds of canisters of tear gas on protesters staging a fourth weekend of demonstrations against the government of President Emmanuel Macron. CNN reporters on the ground also saw police fire rubber bullets. Police say several thousand protesters, most of them male and dressed in "gilets jaunes," the yellow high-visibility jackets that have become the symbol of the movement, converged on the Champs-Elysees at about 11 a.m. local time (5 a.m. ET) chanting "Down with Macron" and "Calm down police." Protesters at the f...

item.title: French unrest: Macron too arrogant to quell the riots, analysts say - RT
item.description:
French unrest: Macron too arrogant to quell the riots, analysts say  RT

As France braces for Saturday's 'Yellow Vests' rally, President Emmanuel Macron shunned the chance to address the discontent, sending his PM to the front lines. The president's arrogance could be making matters worse, experts say. Chants of 'Macron resign!' have become common among yellow-clad protesters opposing the French President's pro-business reforms ‚Äì but the man at the center of the people's grievances is nowhere to be seen. After condemning the violence which marred last Saturday's protest, Macron is keeping an extremely low profile and will not address the nation until Monday, to ...

item.title: France braces for trouble, Macron to address 'yellow vest' anger - Reuters
item.description:
France braces for trouble, Macron to address 'yellow vest' anger  Reuters

France hunkered down for another wave of potentially violent protests on Saturday as embattled President Emmanuel Macron planned to address the nation next week over public fury at the high cost of living, senior allies said. Interior Minister Christophe Castaner said the three-week-old "yellow vest" revolt had "created a monster" and vowed police would have no tolerance for violence, with much of Paris in lockdown and tens of thousands of police deployed nationwide. Named after the fluorescent safety vests that all French motorists must carry, the protesters are billing their planned actio...

item.title: With France on the brink and Germany in limbo, Europe is in a dangerous place - The Independent
item.description:
With France on the brink and Germany in limbo, Europe is in a dangerous place  The Independent

For all of Europe‚Äôs many crises ‚Äì Italian debt, migration, troublesome eastern states, Brexit ‚Äì it seemed until relatively recently that its political leadership was at least strong and stable, to borrow a phrase. As Angela Merkel‚Äôs 18-year reign in Germany drew towards a slightly anti-climactic finale, the emergence of the energetic, charismatic new president of France, Emmanuel Macron, seemed to promise at least another firm hand pointing the way. Now that Ms Merkel‚Äôs Christian Democrats have chosen the favourite to succeed her, Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer, the French seem equally set on r...

item.title: Scuffles, tear gas as police clamp down on Paris protest - The Associated Press
item.description:
Scuffles, tear gas as police clamp down on Paris protest  The Associated Press

PARIS (AP) ‚Äî Crowds of yellow-vested protesters angry at President Emmanuel Macron and France's high taxes tried to converge on the presidential palace Saturday, some scuffling with police firing tear gas, amid exceptional security measures aimed at preventing a repeat of last week's rioting. Blue armored vehicles beneath the Arc de Triomphe and rows of helmeted, thickly protected riot police blocked the demonstrators' passage down the Champs-Elysees avenue toward the heart of presidential power. A ring of steel surrounded the Elysee Palace itself as police stationed trucks and reinforced s...

item.title: The Latest: Paris police turn away protesters, seize goggles - The Associated Press
item.description:
The Latest: Paris police turn away protesters, seize goggles  The Associated Press

PARIS (AP) ‚Äî The Latest on anti-government protests in France and neighboring countries (all times local): 11:55 a.m. Police are seizing protective equipment from journalists and barring some provincial "yellow vest" protesters from boarding trains to Paris, as part of exceptionally stringent security measures to prevent a repeat of last week's rioting. A group of four protesters who came to Paris from Normandy on Saturday told The Associated Press that they saw people wearing yellow vests turned away at train stations all along their route. They said fellow protesters trying to reach Paris...

item.title: France Shows Austerity Is On Its Last Legs In Europe - Forbes
item.description:
France Shows Austerity Is On Its Last Legs In Europe  Forbes

This is not your typical youth protest against politicians: this is middle class and working class adults fed up with Emmanuel Macron bowing to political pressure from the European Union. Here: a demonstrator holds a placard reading ‚Äù Join us‚Äù on Dec.5, 2018 in a protest against a gasoline tax hike. (AP Photo/Bob Edme) Where is this big European growth story we‚Äôve been hearing about? The turnaround came and went. European political crises are one of the top risks for global markets heading into 2019. Paris is literally burning, with more anti-tax protests expected this weekend in the French...

item.title: Why are the 'yellow vests' protesting in France? - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
Why are the 'yellow vests' protesting in France?  Al Jazeera English

For the past three weeks, France has been experiencing one of the most significant social mobilisations in its recent history, which laid bare the country's social ills, anti-elite sentiment, growing inequalities and thirst for social justice. It all started on November 17 when tens of thousands of people took to the streets across the country to protest against rising fuel prices. The protesters, dubbed "Les gilets jaunes" (the yellow vests) after the high-visibility jackets they adopted as a symbol of their complaint, blocked roundabouts, burned effigies and clashed with the police. They...

item.title: Paris riots over fuel taxes dim hopes for climate fight - The Associated Press
item.description:
Paris riots over fuel taxes dim hopes for climate fight  The Associated Press

PARIS (AP) ‚Äî The "yellow vests" in France are worrying greens around the world. The worst riots in Paris in decades were sparked by higher fuel taxes, and French President Emmanuel Macron responded by scrapping them Wednesday. But taxes on fossil fuels are just what international climate negotiators, meeting in Poland this week, say are desperately needed to help wean the world off of fossil fuels and slow climate change. "The events of the last few days in Paris have made me regard the challenges as even greater than I thought earlier," said Stanford University environmental economist Lawr...

item.title: Yellow vests won: France caves into nationwide calls to abandon fuel-tax hike - RT
item.description:
Yellow vests won: France caves into nationwide calls to abandon fuel-tax hike  RT

Emmanuel #Macron's administration has confirmed it will not just suspend, but completely #abandon a proposed #FuelTax hike. item.title: ICYMI: Yellow vests are all the rage on the sidewalks of Paris, as Macron slams into reverse (VIDEO) - RT
item.description:
ICYMI: Yellow vests are all the rage on the sidewalks of Paris, as Macron slams into reverse (VIDEO)  RT

French protesters, angry at a proposed fuel tax increase, have spent recent weekends tearing up the streets of Paris and burning cars, resplendent in their now iconic yellow vests. And it may have worked. President Emmanuel Macron, who said he would never back down in the face of civil unrest, looks to have backed down in the face of civil unrest. His government has decided to scrap the fuel tax increase, and will apparently reverse a tax cut for the rich too. However, if reports are true, the Yellow Vests will be back in force this weekend too, braving the tear-gas-happy riot police, proba...

item.title: On GPS: Will protests harm Macron global role? - CNN
item.description:
On GPS: Will protests harm Macron global role?  CNN

Will protests at home hurt French President Macron's efforts to be seen as a leader of the West? Former U.S. ambassador to NATO Nicholas Burns digs in. ¬©2018 Cable News Network, Inc. A WarnerMedia Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 'France's climb-down on fuel tax is act of panic amid insurrection & possible revolution' - RT
item.description:
'France's climb-down on fuel tax is act of panic amid insurrection & possible revolution'  RT

Elected by default, Macron's administration was supposed to be a new broom to break the mold and change what previous administrations had not dared to, but now we see how fragile political system is, professor John Laughland said. Students are back out on the streets of France protesting against the government's education reforms, forcing over 150 schools to close, with some demonstrations turning violent in a number of cities. This comes as the French government scraps a fuel tax hike after weeks of mass protests against the issue. Meanwhile, French government spokesman Benjamin Griveaux w...

item.title: France prepares for further protests this weekend - Financial Times
item.description:
France prepares for further protests this weekend  Financial Times

France is set for another weekend of demonstrations against President Emmanuel Macron and his policies, as the government appealed for calm and labelled the gilets jaunes protests ‚Äúa monster that has escaped its creators‚Äù. Nearly 90,000 police officers will be deployed across France and central Paris will be in lockdown amid fears of a repeat of last Saturday‚Äôs riots, the worst to hit the capital in 50 years. Dozens of shops and attractions will close on Saturday, including the Louvre art gallery and the Eiffel Tower, while several top division football matches have been cancelled. The Fren...

item.title: #ICYMI: Yellow vests are all the rage! - RT

item.title: France‚Äôs Gas Tax Debacle Bolsters The Case For Green New Deal-Style Climate Policies - HuffPost
item.description:
France‚Äôs Gas Tax Debacle Bolsters The Case For Green New Deal-Style Climate Policies  HuffPost

French President Emmanuel Macron reversed course on his controversial gas tax on Tuesday, announcing a six-month suspension in the face of weeks of fiery protests, where nearly 300,000 motorists donned the yellow vests French law requires drivers keep in their cars and blocked highway traffic. The decision delighted the Wall Street Journal editorial board, who this week feted the protests as a ‚Äúglobal carbon tax revolt‚Äù against ‚Äúgreen piety.‚Äù ‚ÄúNothing reveals the disconnect between ordinary voters and an aloof political class more than carbon taxation,‚Äù the board wrote. It was an unsurprisi...

item.title: Pamela Anderson's political activism ‚Äì from French riots to broken capitalism - The Guardian
item.description:
Pamela Anderson's political activism ‚Äì from French riots to broken capitalism  The Guardian

Following protests that have taken place in France over the past few weeks and riots that saw hundreds arrested in Paris, the gilets jaunes or yellow vests movement has found a vocal, and to some, surprising supporter in Pamela Anderson. Earlier this week the Canadian-American actor and activist, who now lives in France, attempted to explain the aim of the movement in a series of tweets and in a blogpost on her website. Her intervention sparked online appreciation and fury in equal parts as her cogently argued post delved into the complex social issues behind the violence and the rising soc...

item.title: The Latest: 'Yellow vest' members meet with French PM - The Associated Press
item.description:
The Latest: 'Yellow vest' members meet with French PM  The Associated Press

PARIS (AP) ‚Äî The Latest on the protests in France (all times local): 11:50 p.m. Seven members of the "yellow vest" movement say they are satisfied after their meeting with French Prime Minister Edouard Philippe on the eve of anti-government protests that authorities fear could turn violent. One of the participants to the meeting, Christophe Chalancon, told reporters the delegation of protesters called for measures aimed at improving the workers' salaries and the purchasing power of the French. The prime minister "listened to us", he said. Another participant, Jacline Mouraud, said that "we ...

item.title: üá´üá∑France abandons petrol tax rises after deadly protests | Al Jazeera English - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
üá´üá∑France abandons petrol tax rises after deadly protests | Al Jazeera English  Al Jazeera English

The French government is abandoning a fuel tax hike which has led to weeks of violent protests. They've spread into wider demonstrations against President Emmanuel Macron's economic policies - and become his biggest challenge in office so far. French protesters welcome Macron's decision to scrap the fuel tax rise planned for next year but said it may not be enough to contain public anger. Al Jazeera's David Chater reports from Paris. - Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/alj...

item.title: To the barricades: why a nursery aide joins French protests - The Associated Press
item.description:
To the barricades: why a nursery aide joins French protests  The Associated Press

VILLENEUVE-LA-GARENNE, France (AP) ‚Äî With a yellow safety vest tied to her backpack, Mathilde Pouzet set out for Paris on Nov. 17 for her first protest with a grassroots movement that is now shaking France. She returned for the next two, braving tear gas and dodging violence. Three weeks later, she was blockading a fuel depot of gas giant Total, until dozens of police in riot gear cleared out her small group. Now, Pouzet, a 43-year-old aide in a public nursery, and a handful of fellow protesters from her working class town north of Paris are plotting their next blockade. "We have our strate...

item.title: ‚ÄòMacron‚Äôs arrogance unites us‚Äô ‚Äì on the barricades with France‚Äôs gilets jaunes - The Guardian
item.description:
‚ÄòMacron‚Äôs arrogance unites us‚Äô ‚Äì on the barricades with France‚Äôs gilets jaunes  The Guardian

On the grass verge of a village roundabout north of Toulouse, C√©line stood at a barricade built from pallets of wood and old tyres, a bonfire burning behind her. French flags were flying alongside signs calling for Emmanuel Macron‚Äôs resignation. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm prepared to spend Christmas protesting at this roundabout with my children ‚Äì we won‚Äôt back down and we‚Äôve got nothing to lose,‚Äù said the 41-year-old, who voted for Macron in last year‚Äôs presidential election. ‚ÄúHe gave good speeches and I really believed his promises that he would change France. But not any more.‚Äù C√©line, a classroom assistant f...

item.title: Macron's top-down approach to fighting climate change serves as a cautionary tale - CNN
item.description:
Macron's top-down approach to fighting climate change serves as a cautionary tale  CNN

Laurie Garrett is founder of the Anthropos Initiative, which seeks to promote novel technology and governance to slow planetary change that threatens human health and survival. The views expressed in this commentary are her own. View more opinion on CNN. While world leaders gather in Katowice, Poland, for the COP24 climate summit, protesters in the streets of Paris have successfully forced French President Emmanuel Macron's hand, undercutting his efforts to impose a carbon tax on French energy sales. Macron has made climate change and lowering greenhouse gases a central component of both hi...

item.title: Paris warns radicals are trying to exploit Yellow Vests & overthrow the government - RT
item.description:
Paris warns radicals are trying to exploit Yellow Vests & overthrow the government  RT

As France braces for a new wave of protests, a government spokesman warned that radicals are using the Yellow Vest movement to pursue their own goals and one of them is to topple the current leadership. Some 89,000 officers, armored vehicles belonging to military police and increased vigilance ‚Äì that‚Äôs how the nation is getting ready for Act IV, the fourth Saturday of Yellow Vest rallies. This time the protesters say they are to ‚Äústay on their course,‚Äù despite the authorities agreeing to abandon the fuel tax hike. READ MORE: Elysee fears ‚Äòputschists‚Äô, coup attempt during Yellow Vests protes...

item.title: Yellow Vests Loom Large Over UN Climate Summit - Forbes
item.description:
Yellow Vests Loom Large Over UN Climate Summit  Forbes

A Yellow Vest protester kicks back a tear gas canister during clashes as part of a demonstration on November 30, 2018, near major EU buildings in Brussels (ARIS OIKONOMOU/AFP/Getty Images) Last Sunday tens of thousands of people took to the streets of Brussels to protest political inaction on climate change. It was timed for the start of this year‚Äôs UN climate summit in Katowice, Poland 600 miles away. But delegates meeting in Katowice this week have been much more concerned about a protest that had taken place in Brussels two days earlier, when 300 members of the now-notorious ‚Äúyellow vest...

item.title: Spain PM changes tack on budget timing after regional election jolt - Reuters
item.description:
Spain PM changes tack on budget timing after regional election jolt  Reuters

Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Tuesday his government was planning to put forward a proposal for the 2019 budget in January, changing strategy after an electoral setback on Sunday in a Socialist stronghold. Spain's political landscape has been upended by the unprecedented election of 12 far-right lawmakers in the southern Andalusia regional parliament on Sunday, prompting Sanchez to have another go at putting a budget proposal to parliament. "We are going to fulfill our task, which is to present the budget, and I announce that the cabinet in January will approve the proposal,"...

item.title: Paris Riots Show Difficulty of Fighting Warming With Taxes - VOA News
item.description:
Paris Riots Show Difficulty of Fighting Warming With Taxes  VOA News

The ‚Äúyellow vests‚Äù in France are worrying greens around the world. The worst riots in Paris in decades were sparked by higher fuel taxes, and French President Emmanuel Macron responded by scrapping them Wednesday. But taxes on fossil fuels are just what international climate negotiators, meeting in Poland this week, say are desperately needed to help wean the world off of fossil fuels and slow climate change. ‚ÄúThe events of the last few days in Paris have made me regard the challenges as even greater than I thought earlier,‚Äù said Stanford University environmental economist Lawrence Goulder,...

item.title: French government defends heavy-handed police tactics against students - Reuters
item.description:
French government defends heavy-handed police tactics against students  Reuters

France's government on Friday defended the tactics of riot police who forced several dozen detained high-school students to kneel in rows with their hands held behind their heads or in handcuffs after violent protests west of Paris. Students this week have been blocking access to scores of high schools across France in protest at President Emmanuel Macron's education reforms, just as the 40-year-old leader grapples with sometimes-violent demonstrations over living costs. Videos and photos of the students from two high schools in Val Fourre, a deprived neighborhood outside Mantes-La-Jolie, 6...

item.title: No leader, lots of anger: can France's 'yellow vests' become a political force? - Reuters
item.description:
No leader, lots of anger: can France's 'yellow vests' become a political force?  Reuters

It began as a home-spun Facebook campaign against French fuel tax increases. But in a few weeks it has spiraled into a movement powerful enough to force Emmanuel Macron into the biggest U-turn of his presidency. Yet the "yellow-vest" movement -- named for the fluorescent jackets carried by French motorists -- remains an amorphous, hard-to-define group with a rapidly shifting agenda. It has no leader. It named eight spokespeople, some of whom disagreed with each other and one of whom was promptly sacked. Members are broadly opposed to decision-making authority. One of its originators, a 51-y...

item.title: How China Played Its Trump Card At The G20 Summit And Gained The Upper Hand In Trade War - Forbes
item.description:
How China Played Its Trump Card At The G20 Summit And Gained The Upper Hand In Trade War  Forbes

US-China trade dispute set to re-escalate Despite the positive atmospherics, our data continues to indicate that the bilateral meeting between Presidents Trump and Xi at this past weekend‚Äôs G20 summit did not ‚Äî and more importantly, will not ‚Äî result in a major breakthrough in the U.S.-China trade dispute. Per the graph, note that while the G-20 ‚Äúcease fire‚Äù ‚Äì whereby both sides agreed to a temporary cessation of tariff increases and a 90-day negotiation window, while China agreed (in very general terms) to purchase more U.S. goods‚Äì comes near a low in Chinese Investment/ Trade Policy Risk...

item.title: 'Don't drop the ball': U.S. tech investors warn Macron over taxes - Reuters
item.description:
'Don't drop the ball': U.S. tech investors warn Macron over taxes  Reuters

President Emmanuel Macron must pursue tax-friendly policies towards foreign investors if he wants French startups to flourish, visiting Silicon Valley investors told Reuters on Thursday. The visit and associated demands comes at a tough time for the French leader, who faces the fierce opposition of the "Yellow Vest" movement over economic reforms, which are seen as favoring the wealthy. The discreet one-day tour of France's startup scene is the result of two months of intense work by the country's export promotion agency Business France, at the invitation of Macron, who has organized a dinn...

item.title: ‚ÄòLook at me, I exist‚Äô: French protesters send message to Macron - Financial Times
item.description:
‚ÄòLook at me, I exist‚Äô: French protesters send message to Macron  Financial Times

Next to a roundabout on the outskirts of Troyes, 150km south-east of Paris, Sophie surveys the damp tent where she has spent much of the past two weeks. Wearing a fluorescent yellow jacket that marks her as one of the so-called gilets jaunes protesters against President Emmanuel Macron, she gestures at a table where well-wishers have brought fruit, bread and even smoked salmon. ‚ÄúWe have more to eat here than at home,‚Äù she says, her voice barely audible over the din of passing cars and trucks tooting their horns in solidarity. The 25-year-old waitress and thousands of other French men and w...

item.title: S√©gol√®ne Royal: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs quite simple, the French people have had enough of taxes‚Äô - Financial Times
item.description:
S√©gol√®ne Royal: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs quite simple, the French people have had enough of taxes‚Äô  Financial Times

Paris, Wednesday, under leaden grey skies ‚Äî four days after the riots last weekend, when thousands of protesters in yellow safety vests set cars ablaze, threw paving stones at police and stormed the Arc de Triomphe, the city is still in shock. But S√©gol√®ne Royal wishes to remind me why we are lunching in this corner of the capital‚Äôs 16th arrondissement: herself. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs astonishing,‚Äù the former Socialist party presidential candidate says of the demonstrations against fuel taxes that have sparked the biggest crisis of Emmanuel Macron‚Äôs presidency. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm constantly in the media, even tonight ‚Äî b...

item.title: Pyne insists $50b submarine project on track despite blowout reports - ABC News
item.description:
Pyne insists $50b submarine project on track despite blowout reports  ABC News

Serious discrepancies are emerging over the status of Australia's biggest ever defence project. Key points: - Government denies Australia's largest defence project could cost substantially more than expected - Defence Minister Christopher Pyne denies a retired bureaucrat has been brought in to finalise negotiations - He also denies he was contacted for comment despite ABC records showing multiple requests were made The ABC today revealed the first of Australia's new submarines could arrive late and cost substantially more than expected as the Department of Defence attempts to finalise the t...

item.title: Paris protests: Eiffel Tower closes and 90,000 police to be deployed as French capital braces for worst 'yellow vests' protests yet - The Independent
item.description:
Paris protests: Eiffel Tower closes and 90,000 police to be deployed as French capital braces for worst 'yellow vests' protests yet  The Independent

The Eiffel Tower and Louvre are closing their doors to the public and almost 90,000 police officers are poised, as Paris braces for what could be the most violent protest in weeks. France‚Äôs capital has been plagued by unrest since 17 November as anti-government protesters react to a sharp spike in diesel taxes. So far four people have been killed in accidents, and dozens injured in the ‚Äúyellow vests‚Äù movement ‚Äì in reference to the fluorescent safety outfit French motorists keep in their cars. And protesters are now billing their planned action on Saturday as ‚ÄúAct IV‚Äù of the worst unrest see...

item.title: Long Live Gilets Jaune As Macron's Makes A Fuel Tax U-Turn - Forbes
item.description:
Long Live Gilets Jaune As Macron's Makes A Fuel Tax U-Turn  Forbes

There is no other way to put it. The appeasement of the ‚ÄúGilets Jaunes‚Äù (Yellow Vests) who for successive weekends took to the streets of Paris to protest a new fuel tax is a major embarrassment. This act of capitulation will not help the divisions that pervade French society and may well backfire as it signals that aggressive, violent demonstration can effectively alter government policy. Demonstrators are pictured from the top of the Arc de Triomphe on the Champs-Elysees avenue during a demonstration Saturday, Dec.1, 2018 in Paris. Demonstrations against rising taxes turned into scenes o...

item.title: Future submarines could arrive late and cost more, confidential negotiations reveal - ABC News
item.description:
Future submarines could arrive late and cost more, confidential negotiations reveal  ABC News

The first of Australia's new submarines could arrive late and cost substantially more than expected as Defence attempts to finalise the terms of the $50 billion project. Key points: - Former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull selected the French company in 2016 to replace Australia's ageing Collins Class fleet - Defence officials and Naval Group have been locked in tough negotiations since to produce the 12 submarines - Retired deputy Defence secretary Kim Gillis was recruited to lock in the Strategic Partnering Agreement The ABC understands Defence recently offered a two-year extension to the...

item.title: CrossTalk: France Goes Yellow - RT
item.description:
CrossTalk: France Goes Yellow  RT

What does the rise of the ‚ÄòYellow Vest‚Äô movement in France tell us about the state of the neo-liberal order in Europe? Are the protests in France ‚Äì the largest since 1968 ‚Äì just about a hike in fuel prices? And is Emmanuel Macron the right person to be president to address the problems so many have in France? CrossTalking with Bruno Drweski, Luc Rivet, and Louis Chauvel. RT LIVE https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IFAcqaNzNSc Check out http://rt.com Subscribe to RT! http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=RussiaToday Like us on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/RTnews Follow us on VK...

item.title: Mohammed bin Salman: Saudi crown prince met with laughter and confrontations at G20 summit over Khashoggi murder - The Independent
item.description:
Mohammed bin Salman: Saudi crown prince met with laughter and confrontations at G20 summit over Khashoggi murder  The Independent

Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia exchanged laughs and clasped hands with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday in an incongruous moment of apparent celebration as they took their seats among world leaders gathered in Buenos Aires for an economic summit. It was the surest sign yet that the crown prince can still expect a warm welcome from at least some heads of state even after US intelligence agencies and many Western officials concluded he authorised the killing of Jamal Khashoggi, a Virginia resident and Washington Post columnist ambushed two months ago by Saudi agent...

item.title: France girds for weekend protests, fearing more violence - The Associated Press
item.description:
France girds for weekend protests, fearing more violence  The Associated Press

PARIS (AP) ‚Äî Anticipating a fourth straight weekend of violent protests, France on Friday mobilized armored vehicles and thousands of police, cordoned off Paris' broad boulevards and made plans to shut down tourist sites like the Eiffel Tower and Louvre. The heavy security will put central Paris in a virtual lockdown Saturday against what the interior minister called "radicalized and rebellious people," who authorities believe will join members of the "yellow vest" movement that has been holding anti-government demonstrations. Nationwide, about 89,000 police will fan out in the streets, an ...

item.title: EU finance ministers strike eurozone reform deal - Financial Times
item.description:
EU finance ministers strike eurozone reform deal  Financial Times

EU finance ministers have agreed on steps to bolster the eurozone against future financial crises, striking a deal after negotiations that went through the night and pitted French-led reform ambitions against the reluctance of northern European capitals to share more financial risk. Bringing an end to more than 12 months of sensitive negotiations over the future of the single currency, finance ministers in Brussels nailed down a reform package at 7.30am in talks marred by brinkmanship, foot-dragging and lengthy rounds of redrafting designed to finally satisfy the competing demands of Paris,...

item.title: France dials down EU tech tax to push through a deal - Financial Times
item.description:
France dials down EU tech tax to push through a deal  Financial Times

FT subscribers can click here to receive Brussels Briefing every day by email. The Franco-German engine has struck again and this time it‚Äôs ruffled some feathers. In a last-ditch attempt to strike a deal on an EU-wide tech tax for Emmanuel Macron, Paris and Berlin‚Äôs finance ministries have hatched an eleventh hour version of a ‚Äúdigital services tax‚Äù that dials down the ambition but will ramp up the pressure on resisters to finally swallow the idea. The FT on Monday night reported on a sparse one-page Franco-German plan that will be sent round to EU finance ministers this Tuesday morning whe...

item.title: Paris braces for more violent weekend protests - Reuters
item.description:
Paris braces for more violent weekend protests  Reuters

The French capital is on high alert as security services prepare for more demonstrations against President Macron's government reforms.

item.title: On GPS: What French protests mean for Macron - CNN
item.description:
On GPS: What French protests mean for Macron  CNN

Journalist Sophie Pedder warns that violent protests in France have created the "first real political crisis" for President Emmanuel Macron. ¬©2018 Cable News Network, Inc. A WarnerMedia Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Eiffel Tower, Louvre to close amid fears of weekend 'gilets jaunes' protests - CNN
item.description:
Eiffel Tower, Louvre to close amid fears of weekend 'gilets jaunes' protests  CNN

France is bracing for another weekend of protests that could rock Paris and other parts of the country. Prime Minister Edouard Philippe said the government was deploying 89,000 security force members across France -- including 8,000 in the capital -- in case the demonstrations turn violent again. Many of Paris' famed sites -- including the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, the Mus√©e Delacroix and the Paris Opera -- will close over the weekend in advance of the protests, organized by the "gilets jaunes," or "yellow vest" movement. The name comes from the high-visibility yellow vests that drivers are...

item.title: EU embarks on sensitive reforms to financial crisis tools - Financial Times
item.description:
EU embarks on sensitive reforms to financial crisis tools  Financial Times

EU finance ministers will on Monday discuss proposals to give the eurozone more powerful tools to prevent financial crises. While politicians including France‚Äôs President Emmanuel Macron have floated grand ideas such as the appointment of a euro area finance minister, or the creation of a fully fledged European Monetary Fund, months of technical negotiations leading up to Monday‚Äôs so-called eurogroup meeting have focused on more low-key, politically feasible improvements to the currency union‚Äôs plumbing. But the talks have still strayed into highly sensitive territory for some capitals. Pro...

item.title: Macron‚Äôs politics look to Blair and Clinton. The backlash was inevitable - The Guardian
item.description:
Macron‚Äôs politics look to Blair and Clinton. The backlash was inevitable  The Guardian

Rioting in the streets. Filling stations running out of fuel. Panic buying in the supermarkets. A country in chaos. Not a dystopian vision of Britain after Brexit, but France in the here and now under that self-styled champion of anti-populism, Emmanuel Macron. French politicians invariably claim to be inspired by Charles de Gaulle, and Macron is no exception. His official presidential photograph has him standing in front of a desk with a copy of De Gaulle‚Äôs war memoirs open. Macron‚Äôs subliminal message to the French people was obvious. Like De Gaulle, I will be a strong leader. Like De Gau...

item.title: Gilets jaunes: police use teargas to clear Paris protesters - The Guardian
item.description:
Gilets jaunes: police use teargas to clear Paris protesters  The Guardian

French security forces sealed off areas of central Paris on Saturday to contain and control gilets jaunes protesters and prevent a repeat of clashes, violence and burning cars and buildings. Well before sunrise they deployed armoured vehicles at possible flashpoints including Place de la Bastille and the Arc de Triomphe. Officials said it was a ‚Äúhigh-risk‚Äù day and appealed for protesters to stay at home. To avoid a repeat of shocking scenes of cars burning and the smashing and looting shops by fringe elements of the movement, police and gendarmes blocked off areas of central Paris, includin...

item.title: France may reinstate wealth tax to appease yellow vests - Agenzia ANSA
item.description:
France may reinstate wealth tax to appease yellow vests  Agenzia ANSA

(ANSAmed) - PARIS, DECEMBER 5 - French government spokesman Benjamin Griveaux said the government is not excluding the possibility of reinstating the ISF wealth tax, as protests continue by the so-called "yellow vests". The protesters are railing against fuel price hikes but also against the cancellation of the wealth tax, a decision that was made by French President Emmanuel Macron at the start of his five-year mandate and earned him the nickname "president of the rich". In a radio interview on RTL, Griveaux said for the first time that the government could make a dramatic about-face on th...

item.title: May refuses to say if she challenged Saudi crown prince over allegation he ordered Khashoggi murder - The Independent
item.description:
May refuses to say if she challenged Saudi crown prince over allegation he ordered Khashoggi murder  The Independent

Theresa May has refused to say if she challenged the Saudi crown prince over allegations he ordered the killing of Jamal Khashoggi, despite vowing to have ‚Äúrobust‚Äù talks. The prime minister courted controversy at the G20 summit by holding a lengthy private meeting with Mohammad bin Salman, just hours after he was confronted in public by Emmanuel Macron. Asked, ahead of leaving Argentina, if she had asked bin Salman if he was behind what she called the ‚Äúterrible murder‚Äù in the Saudi consulate in Turkey, Ms May ducked the question. Read more - Trump held talks with Putin on sidelines of G20 s...

item.title: Gilets jaunes protests: Eiffel Tower and Louvre to shut amid fears of violence - The Guardian
item.description:
Gilets jaunes protests: Eiffel Tower and Louvre to shut amid fears of violence  The Guardian

Tourist attractions and museums in central Paris have said they will not open on Saturday, when fresh gilets jaunes (yellow vests) protests are planned, as French authorities prepared to deploy 65,000 security personnel across the country. ‚ÄúThe demonstrations announced on Saturday 8 December in Paris do not allow us to welcome visitors in safe conditions,‚Äù said the operator of the Eiffel Tower in a statement on Thursday. Police have also ordered about a dozen museums, including the Louvre and the Grand Palais, cultural sites such as the Opera and shops along the Champs-√âlys√©es to close over...

item.title: Fearing 'Act IV' of unrest, France to close Eiffel Tower, Louvre, at weekend - Reuters
item.description:
Fearing 'Act IV' of unrest, France to close Eiffel Tower, Louvre, at weekend  Reuters

France will close the Eiffel Tower and other tourism landmarks in Paris and draft in thousands more security forces on Saturday to stave off another wave of violent protests in the country over living costs. With protesters from the "yellow vest" movement calling on social media for "Act IV" - a fourth weekend of protest - Prime Minister Edouard Philippe said 89,000 police nationwide would be deployed to stop a repeat of last Saturday's mayhem across France. About 8,000 of these would be deployed in Paris where rioters torched cars and looted shops off the famed Champs Elysees boulevard, an...

item.title: A bluffer‚Äôs guide to eurozone reform (updated) - Financial Times
item.description:
A bluffer‚Äôs guide to eurozone reform (updated)  Financial Times

FT subscribers can click here to receive Brussels Briefing every day by email. It's a marathon eurogroup day in Brussels. Finance ministers are bedding in for a long night (‚Äúbring a sleeping bag‚Äù says one official) to finalise a package of policies that are supposed to be signed off by EU leaders later this month. The reforms mark the end of a more than year long process ‚Äî supercharged by Emmanuel Macron ‚Äî to strengthen the eurozone‚Äôs crisis-fighting architecture. As the FT explains, the French might think it slim pickings compared to Mr Macron‚Äôs ambitious opening demands, but the final com...

item.title: Paris in flames: The photos out of France are getting more intense as city braces for more protests - MarketWatch
item.description:
Paris in flames: The photos out of France are getting more intense as city braces for more protests  MarketWatch

By Maria LaMagna, Associated Press ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs quite simple. People have had enough of taxes‚Äô School children demonstrate in Paris on Friday. Footage showing the brutal arrest of high-school students protesting outside Paris is causing a stir ahead of further antigovernment protests this weekend. Associated Press The City of Lights is battling flames this week. Protests in France have escalated over the past several days, resulting in four deaths and damage to the city. In response, France has mobilized tens of thousands of police officers and made plans to shut down more than a dozen tourist att...

item.title: Are the French hit especially hard by fuel taxes? - The Guardian
item.description:
Are the French hit especially hard by fuel taxes?  The Guardian

Despite a backdrop of riots against high fuel levies in France, European commission data shows that taxes on all petrol products have actually fallen in the last two years across the eurozone. The level has fallen from almost 70% of the cost for consumers at the pump to 60.9% at the end of November. In France, it is a similar story, with taxes on fuel (before the increased levy on diesel kicks in) accounting for a smaller proportion of total prices than they did at the start of Emmanuel Macron‚Äôs presidency. Related: Share your reaction and experiences of the French gilets jaunes protests Th...

item.title: Trump retweets apparently false claim of Paris protesters chanting - CNN
item.description:
Trump retweets apparently false claim of Paris protesters chanting  CNN

President Donald Trump on Tuesday retweeted conservative activist Charlie Kirk, who claimed that protesters on the streets of Paris are chanting "we want Trump" but a corresponding video appears to show London. No video was included in Kirk's tweet but one circulating among Trump-supporting social media accounts appears to be shot in Trafalgar Square in London. The police in the video are English, an English flag is visible during the start of the video, and the blue, double-decker bus in the shot appears to be operated by a company that does sightseeing tours of London. But Kirk, whom Trum...

item.title: Yellow Vests leader who vowed to approach Elysee under investigation ‚Äì media - RT
item.description:
Yellow Vests leader who vowed to approach Elysee under investigation ‚Äì media  RT

Eric Drouet, one of the Yellow Vests leaders who called on demonstrators to march towards the official residence of Emmanuel Macron, is now under investigation for organizing ‚Äúunlawful protests,‚Äù French media report. The 33-year-old truck driver, who turned into a voice of the powerful movement, made headlines on Thursday. ‚ÄúSaturday will be the final outcome. Saturday it's the Elysee. We would all like to go to the Elysee. We are all united to the end and we move on the direction of Elysee,‚Äù he said. READ MORE: Paris warns radicals are trying to exploit Yellow Vests & overthrow the governme...

item.title: German carmaker chiefs to have White House talks on tariffs - Financial Times
item.description:
German carmaker chiefs to have White House talks on tariffs  Financial Times

The bosses of Germany‚Äôs three largest carmakers will meet senior US officials on Tuesday to try to ease tension with Washington over trade, with President Donald Trump threatening to impose swingeing import tariffs on European vehicles. Chief executives from BMW, Daimler and Volkswagen will hold direct talks in the US with commerce secretary Wilbur Ross and Robert Lighthizer, Mr Trump‚Äôs top trade official. Larry Kudlow, the president‚Äôs chief economic adviser, said the focus would be the companies‚Äô investment into the US and their use of US-made engines. A person briefed on the automakers‚Äô p...

item.title: Macron says he pressed on Saudi writer‚Äôs death - infobae
item.description:
Macron says he pressed on Saudi writer‚Äôs death  infobae

(AFP) French President Emmanuel Macron says he pressed Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to allow international involvement in the investigation into the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Macron confronted the crown prince at a Group of 20 summit in Argentina. Macron said Saturday that in the exchange, he also pushed bin Salman to help find a political solution to the Saudi-backed war in Yemen, and to help stabilize world oil prices. Jamal Ahmad Khashoggi was a Saudi Arabian journalist, dissident, author, and a general manager and editor-in-chief of Al-Arab News Channel who was as...
